content.en: Glioma research advancements: Scientists have used algorithms to address various research questions related to gliomas, a type of brain tumor. These algorithms were employed to analyze gene expression data, develop gene classifiers, filter prognostic-related genes, select candidate genes, construct risk signatures, integrate molecular and immunohistochemical profiles, identify survival markers, classify molecular subtypes, identify genomic instability-derived genes, predict prognosis and treatment response, analyze gene expression profiles, reclassify tumor samples, identify growth-related genes and subtypes, develop grade scoring systems, and assess the association between glioma stemness subtypes and prognosis and drug response. These findings highlight the power of algorithms in understanding and predicting outcomes in glioma patients.
content.da: Fremskridt inden for gliomaforskning: Forskere har brugt algoritmer til at tackle forskellige forskningsspørgsmål relateret til gliomer, en type hjernetumor. Disse algoritmer blev anvendt til at analysere genekspressionsdata, udvikle genklassifikatorer, filtrere prognoserelaterede gener, udvælge kandidatgener, konstruere risikounderskrifter, integrere molekylære og immunohistokemiske profiler, identificere overlevelsesmarkører, klassificere molekylære undertyper, identificere genomisk ustabilitets-afledte gener, forudsige prognose og behandlingsrespons, analysere genekspressionsprofiler, reklassificere tumorsamples, identificere vækstreleterede gener og undertyper, udvikle gradscoringssystemer og vurdere sammenhængen mellem gliomastamcelletyper og prognose samt lægemiddelrespons. Disse resultater fremhæver algoritmers kraft i at forstå og forudsige resultater hos gliomapatienter.
